Views, pREvIEws
AMD REVIEWS


Edward Banks

The passage Of the CiUil Rights bin by
federal lawmakers Will h0Ue far Yea ching
results on the HUes Of the citizens not only
Of diffeYent c0LOYS, races, etbnic b0 ckgYOu'ads
and national origins, but 1T W5H set goals for
all.


Too many gears h0Ue been spent by cey-
tain states and cities TO end the terrible
inequities which exist for many persons 1Oho
are not eau cosi0ns.


The cjUil rights measure covers several
aspects Of life and although the loobholes
and the legal POINTS in 1t might be used to
ciYcunUent the lam, neUeYthe less, for the
first time since the end Of the CiOil War,
the Negroes and other nin0YitieS Will haze
some federal by0te ction.


The beginning Of the second one hundred
years after the emancipation Of the Negroes
in the United States, is taking a foYuUaYd
look with the ena ctnaent Of the chill rights
biu Now, ne must strive for the extension
Of fun citizenship rights to all. States,
counties and cities must shake the chains
from their feet and move ahead and YecOg-
nike that Negroes, Indians, Jews. Puerto
RicanS, Neutrality-suspicious. and other
minority groups must be accepted as first
class citizens with equal rights.

A few weeks ago two hombres
we're arrested in this western
town for stealing. Now, don't
get your eyebrows too far apart,
pardner, thse men we're caught
redhanded with the goods. They
had sneaked into the desert and
robbed Mother Nature.


No self respecting thief would
claim these two men. They have
ruined the outlawng for years to
come. No longer can ! watch a
real rootin' tootin' hardridin'
gunslingin' western on the screen
without flinching at these two
men.


No. they didn't steal a calf or
a horse--guess what these two
brave modern light fingered Har-
rvs stole Is cactus plants.
Too bad--they will become the
laughingstock of the cellblock.


These misguided sticky fin
gered males made the daily news
paper with a cacti snatching
story. They we're apprehended
when they tried to sell the plants
to an alert nurseryman. Guess.
he knew his real plants from hot
ones.


The West amt what it used to
bel In other words home on the
range has been altered to home
with all built-ins plus range.
Ridin' Ole Paint has become
swooping along in my Barracuda
or breezing in our Thunderbird.


You might get western flavor
II you ride In a new Mustang,
but where's the real. live West7
You could visit Scottsdale, where
the city fathers urge you to visit
the Vests most western town.
All | can ever view as | drive
east to Scottsdale is the western
facades Of the buildings--most of
them look phony or funny (as you
desire).


Time was when men who took
to thieving stole money or hor-
ses, sometimes both. But who In
thunderation ever heard of pair
of cacti-nappers.


Once a year Rodeo Week allows
all Of the redblooded men in the
Valley to wear boots and Lewis
and play at being cowpokes. Some
even grow boards and all groups
sponsor a square dance or two
for the atmosphere.


Nowadays our region gets ma
tional and international attention
from the hundreds of western and
cowboy movies shown daily on the
movie and teleWsion screens
from Manila to Copenhagen. Ina
CINE a western bandit getting
gunned down by the sheriff for
robbing the desert gardens


Ihad nearly recovered from
the cactus plant robbers when
another blow came to end the
image Of the West. A wild game
hunter in our midst had been blk
ing his customers with trained
dogs and pre-captured animals.


This sly hunter would place his


coNIT PAGE

Every house hunters goal is to
buy a home built with quality
materials without paying a prem

ium. One quality item to look for
is roof of heavyweight asphalt
shingles with the Underwriters
Laboratories "wind resistant"
label.

The mOuthingS Of Malcolm X, the former
right hand assistant Of Elijah AAthamn,0d,
founder Of the Black Mus Inns, are border
ing on the verge of insanity.


He is unsOtsely and untbinkingly urging
Negroes in America to arm thenSe hes and
prepare for guerilla attacks against the
unite population.


When he uithdYew from the Black Muslin
organization, Malcolm X formed nesV
group, n0aO he has banded together a neV.
political group as NEIL. This group called
the AfYO-AmeYic0n Freedom Fighters, IS
strictly a political body, which he hopes to
link with african nations.


He believes that the AAFF Will be a basic
force to overthrow the ''1O1aite Devils" just #
as the Algerian freedom fighters and the
Aau Mau did in Africa.


AS he travels about bYe0 ching the bhilOS-
Obhy Of hate and MAR, Malcolm X should
remember that only in the United States
would he be able to openly advocate such
drastic measures.


No one can be sure, but it is certain that
some Of his mild yantings are parity yesbon-
Sible for some Of the senSelesS bloodshed in
NeW York by young Negro hO0dh4naS.
